org.ecoinformatics.seek.querybuilder

Class DBQueryDef

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ecoinformatics.seek.querybuilder.DBQueryDef

  • public class DBQueryDef
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a single query. It is made up of three different parts:
    1) The "select" part that describes all the fields that will be "displayed" by the query
    2) The "joins" part that is basically table/field name pairs
    3) The "where" part which describes a heirarchical (tree) of operators and conditions

      Was unable to convert a set of complex ORs to a standard format
      static int BUILD_TOO_COMPLEX_WHERE
      More than likely the where clause had a mix of ANDs and ORs

    • Method Detail

      • isAdv

        public boolean isAdv()
        Returns whether it considers the query to be "advanced"
        An advanced query is one that was built with the advanced tab and then saved out. It is more of a hint to the tool when reading queries back in.
        Returns:
        true if it is advanced, false if standard

      • setIsAdv

        public void setIsAdv(boolean aIsAdv)
        Sets the hint as to whether it is an advanced query
        Parameters:
        aIsAdv - The mIsAdv to set.

      • getWhere

        public DBWhereIFace getWhere()
        A copy of the where object and all of its children. It traverses and builds a duplicate tree of the where object
        Returns:
        a copy of the where object and all of its children

      • getSelects

        public java.util.Vector getSelects()
        The vector of items representing the the items to be disdplayed
        The items are object of class DBSelectTableModelItem
        Returns:
        the Vector of selects, (the display elements)

      • getJoins

        public java.util.Vector getJoins()
        Returns a vector of pairs of items, meaning this vector MUST have an even number of items. The objects are of class DBSelectTableModelItem
        Returns:
        the vector of join pairs

      • setJoins

        public void setJoins(java.util.Vector aJoins)
        Sets a vector of DBSelectTableModelItem "pairs", assumes that the vector always holds an even number of elements, one left and right in pairs
        Parameters:
        aJoins - the join vector
